Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Fairly good-looking and comfortable.
Cons: Sound, Build, Price
These headphones are garbage.
They have slow, muddy, bloated, one-note bass, a dry, unnatural midrange, and almost no treble whatsoever.
Horribly congested, almost no separation whatsoever. Soundstage is tiny and imaging is poor. Detail retrieval is poor. Bass is so bloated and unbalanced with the mids and treble that it masks and obscures what little detail they do convey.
Completely plastic construction. Cabling is decent, but overall build is atrocious.
Ridiculously overpriced. You are paying $40 for the headphones, and the rest is for the Beats name.
Audio Technica ATH-M50 completely stomps these and every other headphone in the Beats line at around $150.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Portable, Stylish
Cons: Overpriced, Badly Build, Decent Sound
These are headphones are not a good pair of headphones. People who buy these headphones buy them because they want Beats but are too cheap to buy Studios. I will go over three major parts in this review to tell you why you should buy headphones from a company known for doing audio, not CABLES.
Sound These sound decent. They are much more balanced than the regular Solos. The mids and highs are definitely clearer on these headphones than on the regular Solos. The bass is definitely less, but still enough. Still for $200 these are a complete rip-off.
Comfort/Fit These are pretty comfortable. They are on-ear, but the earcups are very soft and plush. You could definitely wear these for a few ho ... urs without excruciating pain to your ears. The fit is quite good, since they are very small and light they stay on your head relatively securely without them moving around too much.
Build As with pretty much all "designer" headphones these have horrible build quality. The hinges are plastic and start getting loose after only about a month of use. The extenders are a bit too stiff and feel badly designed as well. The plastic on the outside of the headband feels cheap and all the materials just feel very budget and cheap. I would expect better build quality even for a $50 pair of headphones. Very poor.
Overall I think that these headphones deliver decent sound and are quite portable, but who spends $200 on something that will last only a few months? If you do, go buy a pair of Solo HDs. I have warned you. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: BASS, BASS, BASS! Looks, Comfort, Durable, Crystal Clear, Compact
Cons: Can I say they are too good? (I cant listen to anything else now without disappointment)
Wow, what to say about these headphones. First off, I love beats by dre and I will defend them forever in the Beats Vs. Bose debate. Bose are a little more airy but cannot match the sound, the bass, or the looks of beats. When I first bought these for myself as a Christmas gift I opened them up and was like, "Huh, I thought theyd be bigger". Anyways when I put them on, the first thing I did was play the song "Low" by ludacris. IT WAS MIND BLOWING!!! It felt like if you put the palms of both your hands on your ears. That is about the only I can explain it. The bass is game changing, the highs are clear as a be ... ll, and the mids are sharp. No matter how loud you have them you will always have crystal clear sound quality and NO STATIC. They let you hear what I call "super-lows" or things you CANNOT hear on regular headphones. When I went to school the next day I wore them and I saw tons of people staring at me. I had many people ask if they could buy them off of me and an uncountable amount of people ask if they could listen to them. I actually got kind of scared that someone would try to steal them when I wasn't looking. I have had them about 7 months now and just last week my last cordd frayed. I still can listen to them but it only comes out of one ear( and yet they still are better than any other headphones I have ever listened to) and I plan on replacing them ASAP. The ONLY thing I can complain about is that YOU MUST BE SURE TO BUY THEM AT A OFFICIAL STORE. there are allot of imitators of them out there. If you go on the "Beats by Dre" website they have a clear warning against it. If you read ANY bad reviews about ANY beats product you can pretty much guarantee they are frauds. They came with a travel case, 2 replacement cords, and a cleaning strip( which I love and use on all types of electronic screens). The travel case is made of very soft materials and I love because it can carry my phone, 2 cords and the Beats themselves, and can still fit inside my pocket. The ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Style, Portability, Cable
Cons: Build quality, Sound, Price
Let me start out by saying that I am not writing a negative review because of a bias against Beats by Dre. In all actuality, I really like the brand and I have multiple products from them. However, these headphones are disgraceful. I wish I could point out something about these cans that might make them worth buying, but sadly, I cannot.
I'll break down the review into terms of sound quality (lows/mids/highs), comfort, and durability. Then, I'll add some additional comments at the end.
Lows: A lot of bass, but not in a good way. Very muddy, uncontrolled, and overpowering. Destroys the rest of the music.
Mids: Practically nonexistent because the bass is too busy drowning it out.
Highs ... : Sound very distant at normal volumes, almost as if your in a large room with echoes. At high volumes, can be very harsh.
Comfort: Very lightweight. After long periods of listening your ears will get quite sore and the discomfort really does grow on you quickly. Also, the headband is not padded very well.
Durability: If it's possible to have something worse than the sound quality, this is it. You could be the most gentle person in the world and chances are that these will still break. Simply taking them off of your head will sometimes snap them in half. Awful. A joke.
I suppose the only thing that can salvage these headphones is style, the cable (phone/mp3 compatible playback/call buttons), and the portability. These still cannot make up for the awful sound reproduction and build quality that stick out like a sore, beaten, stepped on, run over, thumb.
If you're about to drop $200 on a pair of on-ear headphones, save yourself $40-$80 and get the SOL Republic Tracks HD or the Klipsch Image One On-Ear Headphones.
Once again, I am not writing this to bash Beats by Dre in anyway. I'm writing this to try and save everybody some time and money. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Stylish, but the sound isn't worth $200
Item.Review:
Pros: They look great, fold-able, the wire, the hard case, Bass, comfortable
Cons: Mids, Highs, Somewhat muddy sound
I honestly must say, these headphones look really great. In terms of pure aesthetics, not many other headphones can surpass these cans. However, I do believe that the sound quality of these headphones are sub-par, as compared to other headphones of this price range. For only bass? I wouldn't pay $200. I compared these cans to my Bose Quietcomfort 2 and my various other Studio headphones.
Everybody mind, I listen to a whole range of music. Whereas the QC2s only shine in their mids and highs, Solos only shine in their lows. Even so, I really think that Beats headphones in general provide a sub-par and muddy sound quality. The only thing that comes is boomi ... ng bass, but even so, it sounds distorted. That being said, if you were to buy these headphones, only look for these if you listen to anything with lots and lots of bass, and not much real focus on mids and highs (meaning these aren't good for classical, electronica, jpop, kpop, etc.).
If you listen to a whole spectrum of music, and like a balance between the three sound frequencies, go for some studio headphones (Sennheiser, Audio-Technica, AKG, etc.) . Mind, despite their being notorious for having ridiulously long cords (3m?) they will provide to you very good quality sounds on lows, mids, and highs; whereas hi-fi headphones (Bose, Beats, etc.) tweak their output to provide you very good quality sound in their specific target frequencies. So essentially, choose your poison when you're looking for cans to listen to, in the long term.
Suggestions for Studio headphones within this price range: Audio-Technica M50 Sennheiser HD 280 Pro Shure SRH440 AKG Acoustics K-240 expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: They Look nice
Cons: price, muddy sound, tight fit
I had very high expectations of these, based on the price, hype and such, but unfortunately they didn't meet my expectations at all.
First and foremost, they didn't sound that crisp/clear. I expected so much more on that end, but what I heard was muffled and bassy, with not so much on the high end/clear side. The clarity was just 'meh'. Very surprised at that...
As far as fit and comfort, they initially felt very nice and cushiony , but after about 10 minutes, my head started to hurt. Maybe they are just too tight? I don't know...but I couldn't' really deal with wearing them for too long. I've never had that problem with headphones...
One good thing about them...they look nice. But, that's about all ... I can give them. The extra cords, packaging, carry case...yeah, that's all nice and pretty, but the "sound" and "fit" we well below par for that price.
Make sure if you're looking at these, you try them on at a Best Buy locally, and spend a few minutes listening to them. These were a gift to me, and had I known and been able to try them on, I would have avoided them and gone for a different brand like Sennheiser, Sony or Klipsh. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound, Quality, Style, Travel Case
Cons: Price...but it's worth it
I just got myself a pair of these after spending hours reading reviews. STOP READING REVIEWS NOW! These new generation Dr. Beats do NOT have the same breaking issue as the previous. I can bend and contort these as much as I want.
The sound, it's great. I listen to some hip-hop and rap, but mostly rock. I think these make rock sound incredible. I can feel the drums (double bass = incredible). As a drummer, this is great. And for hip-hop or rap, they sound great as well. Same for dance/electronic/dub step. I'm no audiophile, but the mids and highs sound great. Anyone saying otherwise is being ridiculous. I haven't listened to much classical on these, but so far it's fine. But if you are getting thes ... e and you listen to classical more than anything else, then you clearly aren't the brightest person.
Style. Obviously they look good.
The travel case is good. The way the headphones fold is great too. Nice and compact for traveling.
Comfort. I've had mine on at all times since I bought them. Very comfortable. I'll play video games and just turn on my iPod with these so I can use them. Never got uncomfortable.
The last thing I'll say is these keep the sound in VERY well. If I have these on, I can't hear anything. I've missed phone calls because of these. And my office mate has had to throw paper at me to get my attention sometimes. And not because I'm blasting the music, they just do that good of a job keeping noise out. I use them when I play drums instead of earplugs now.
All in all, if you have $200 (I got them for $180 on sale, w00t) you are willing to spend, I'd say these will be just fine. I'm really glad I stopped reading every review on every website and just went and got them. Even if you dont have $200 off the bat, there is a 6 month financing option. And to be safe, get the $30 insurance in case ANYTHING happens to them. User error or otherwise. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Great sound quality but horrible design
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality
Cons: Design and price
The solos produce an incredible sound quality. The bass is impeccable and all genres of music sound great. I had two main issues with these headphones though: 1) Within 10 minutes of wearing them I would start to feel them getting tighter around my head and after 45 minutes I would have to take them off because of the pain. 2) The ear muffs on these headphones have a horrible design. By overdoing the complexity and having them pivot and rotate in every possible direction they ruined them. I noticed that my right ear muff would have a creaking sound that eventually was constantly overwhelming the music. I had to exchange that pair for a new pair. To no surprise the new pair had the same issue but with the left ear muff. I eventu ... ally ended up returning them completely. These headphones are overpriced and are not worth the money by any means. These headphones taught me one thing: don't buy into a new product on the market unless you're 100% certain they are good quality. In my opinion, stick to the companies that have been around for years and have more experience like Bose and Sony. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Perfect for those who listen to all sorts of music
Item.Review:
Pros: Notice things in songs i've never noticed before, exceptional clarity, ControlTalk
Cons: Comfortable, but not for too long.
I received these as a graduation present from my parents (who are very technology savvy), and I'm glad they decided on these. I am constantly listening to music. Mostly rock/metal, but I listen to literally everything. These headphones nail EVERY genre. They are a little on the bassy side, but you can simply change your EQ in iTunes or your iPod if it bothers you that much. After all, they are Dre headphones, so they'll obviously be bassy.
My ONLY negative comment is the comfort. They are comfortable for long periods of time as long as you slide them off every once in a while. I have some big ole' ears and these press them to the side of my ... head, but it's not painful. I record guitar/bass through my computer often, so I wear them for hours at a time and they really give a beautiful, true sound to the music I create. If it sounds good on these, it'll definitely sound good enough on cheap headphones or speakers.
The ControlTalk feature is pretty nifty. I can control songs and volume on my iPod classic and even through iTunes when I plug into my Macbook Pro (so I don't know if this will work on Windows computers).
My parents bought the extended warranty on them, so I have no worries of the durability. I obviously will take care of them and they seem durable enough. Especially the cables, those are really high quality (and you get two). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
They're amazing! Don't let other reviews scare you! I was always finding people were saying "the bass is muddy - it's too cloudy sounding" but all you need to do is change your equalizer settings in your music! If you have an iPhone/Pod it's easy. "Rock" is a pretty good setting for me. The Control Talk is also convenient if you have an iPhone/Pod also; the buttons are pretty easy to identify without having to look or feel around for the right one. I've had them on since I bought them today (3 hours) No discomfort! Usually over the ear headphones end up rubbing my head the wrong way or uncomfortable on my ears, but these are great! They got warm for a moment while I was using them, but I was moving around quite a bit so it was probably just me. The soft cushions are ... great because it blocks a LOT of sound out. Like a lot. I listen to music pretty loud, but I know when there's leakage and these are great! They may be a little expensive, but I think they'll be worth it in the long run. AND if you're a best buy card holder you have 6 months to pay them off which is pretty good! $29 for two years of protection on them, including fixing loose screws and such, or repadding the ear parts if they come loose, or if the folding mechanism breaks, it'll get replaced. Well worth the $29 bucks! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: educate yourself before believing the hype
Item.Review:
Pros: style and bass response
Cons: build quality, requires battery, mid-range and high-range, overly colored sound
I write this review to forewarn you about Beats By Dre, by Monster, as a brand and headphone line. While they are nice sounding headphones, compared to other headphones in the same price range made by truly reputable long running headphone makers, these fall short sound quality-wise. (AKG, Grado, Sennheisers that cost more than $200, Audio-Technica, Sony Studio Pros)
On a scale of 1-10 these would rate about a 6.5 or 7. Most people are used to your run-of-the-mill department store headphones (skullcandy, sony, white apple earbuds, etc) and compared to those, these sound worlds better, however if you compared these to truly good headphones then you'd hear ... what you're missing. These have a good bass response but are lacking elsewhere.
These are just highly marketed to a specific segment of the population to fool you into thinking you're getting the best money can buy. Don't believe the hype. Read a reputable headphone/audio forum, such as head-fi or audioholics, and you'll see the overwhelming negative opinions by people who both, KNOW audio and don't fall for the marketing and peer blitz.
If bass and style is all you care about, and over spending for headphones is your thing, then go ahead and get them. If you want the best sound for the price and don't care about style and image then you can get comparably sounding headphones for less, probably half as much. This is a good article that'll explain it more: http://2011/07/headphone-popularity.html expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Too much bass, didn't seem durable
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound - when you use an equalizer
Cons: Seem flimsy, way too much bass
With the right songs - and with your equalizer set to minimize the bass - these headphones sound great. They block out a ton of noise (not as much as the Bose 15's, but more than nearly any other style I tried in this price range), and you really get a lot of depth and detail in the music.
That said, I found that I really needed the equalizer in iTunes set to "treble booster" or "bass reducer" or something similar, or else these were just painful to wear for extended periods due to the heavy, heavy bass. It would have been OK, except that there is no equalizer for Pandora on iPhone - so I was stuck with way too much bass, and no way to change it.
So, if you like really, really hea ... vy bass, these might be perfect. Otherwise, I'd check out the ($300) Bose 15's, B&W's - or do what I did and pick up a pair of Skullcandy Skullcrushers. The bass is optional, and they're a lot less expensive, and they also block out a ton of office noise (which is half the issue in getting your music to sound good). True, they don't sound as good as the Beats. But I simply couldn't deal with the bass.
One more note - the Beats don't seem like the most durable headphones, especially the way they fold up. I've read that the previous models snapped a lot - that seems to have been fixed somewhat with the HD's, but there may still be issues. I would recommend the Best Buy warranty on these because of that. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound; aesthetics

I've owned and used these headphones for about 6 months now. I was reluctant to spend so much on headphones but I had a bunch of gift cards that I needed to use up. First, the sound quality on these bad boys is AMAZING. Crystal clear and made all of my music sound great. I thought the whole "Dr Dre" thing was hype to get a higher sticker price out of these but based on sound alone they are well worth it. Second, and the worst part about these headphones and why I would never buy them again, they are NOT comfortable. I wear these for hours at work (or at least I try to until they start to hurt) and after about an hour or so the part that goes across the top of your head HURTS. There is very little padding there and after ... awhile it just gives you a headache. VERY poor design for such an expensive set of headphones. Seriously, it may not sound like a big deal but if you are looking for a set of headphones to wear and listen to music for more than an hour at at time, LOOK ELSEWHERE and find some with better padding and comfort across the part that goes over your head. After about an hour I unfortunately need to take these off because it hurts my head so bad. Whatta shame because I could leave them on all day with the awesome sound that they produce. But that means nothing if they are not comfortable. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White

I know people have had problems with these headphones breaking in the folding joint area so I bought the 2 year warranty for them; however I have not had a problem with these feeling flimsy or fragile. I would still be careful with them though.
As far as music genres I listen to a lot of different types but mainly Hard rock, metal and screamo. These headphones preform excellent with all types. I've run them with opera, country, classical, oldies, classic rock, rock, hard rock, metal, and screamo, and even straight ... instrumental, then there is hip hop and rap that these headphones were made for.
Some bands that I used were Screamo: A Day to remember, Bullet for my Valentine, and Devil Wears Prada. Hard rock/metal: Disturbed, Breaking Benjamin, Korn, Godsmack. Classic rock: Foreigner, Queen, Iron Butterfly, Billy Idol. Hip Hop/Rap: Eminem, DMX, Linkin Park, Young Jeezy. Intrumental: Sandstorm, apocalyptica, In a Godda Divida, and some techno.
As for comfort goes these are very comfortable, I have super sensitive ears and need something that i can wear for long periods of time. If your going off headphones on a best buy display, just know that those have been broken in and aren't as tight as new ones. I could only wear mine for about 10 min before my ears hurt but after i got used to them and they broke in I can wear them for hours.
I rated price only 4 stars cause these are pretty expensive, I would like to see them at around $150 cause they put a dent in you wallet but other than that Defiantly worth the money.
The last thing. If you have downloaded songs that aren't from itunes and are not as good of quality you will notice it. They will be staticy. expand » « collapse

Audio Technica ATH-M50 - $150 Sony Studio Pro MDR-V6 or 7506 - $75-125 Sennheiser HD25-1 II - $175 ... r> These are just a few suggestions that sound better in every aspect (lows, mids, highs) and will last much longer.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Make no mistake, these are terrible headphones
Item.Review:
Pros: You look kinda cool wearing them
Cons: Sound quality and durability
Make no mistake, if you're buying these, it's just to look cool in front of your friends. I consider myself a bit of an audiophile and often pay a little extra for what I consider a good listening experience. After hearing about the hype of Beat Heaphones, I decided to give them a real test at the store. Let me just say, I was dumbfounded by how terrible they were.
The first thing you'll notice is the build quality; it feels cheap and fragile. Everything is plastic, not that there's anything wrong with plastic, but this stuff just feels flimsy. But hey, you're paying for sound quality, right? So lets puts these bad boys on...
And then it's like a slap in the face. I would say most heaphone ... s for $100 will DESTROY these in terms of audio quality; the audio you get from these is just too muddy. Nothing really sings in any range. And the bass (which is supposed to be the big deal with these headphones) is garbled. The only thing I can say is that they're better than the earbuds that came with your MP3 player (but then again, what isn't?).
If these were less than $100, I might consider it reasonable. As it stands, I now judge anyone who owns these to be grossly misinformed. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: What a let down, all around.
Item.Review:
Pros: You get to show off the Beats "b" on the side of your head
Cons: The Beats "b" is all they are good for, sound quality sucks
I expected a $200 set of headphones would sound better. There is a ton of base but not much on the high end and what does come through doesn't sound clear as you would think it should.
I bought these at the Las Vegas airport from a Best Buy express vending machine, kinda as an impulse buy, because my little iPhone ear buds just weren't cutting it on the loud plane. I have heard of the Beats brand and hear that they are some of the best around. I saw that they had 3 versions of "over the ear" headphones (* I will explain why I put over the ear in quotes later) and thought that even though the Solo ones were the cheapest, they are still gonna ... be way better than what I am used to. WRONG!!! Although they had better base response, over all they sounded like cheap junk. The high end was completely muffled, and almost missing entirely.
* (They are not over the ear headphones, they are on ear. I passed up cheaper Bose on ear headphones because I thought that these were over the ear, meaning that they would rest against my head, but nope they sit on your ear just like the Bose.)
So I ended up not using them on my flight back and used my stock iPhone buds. Here is the big problem though. Once I got home and opened the automatic email that contained my receipt, I see that there is basically no return policy. It says that they only return unopened product, or defective product. I am sure that this is because people will basically "rent" the items they want and once they get home return them. The thing is, I still want a good set of true over the ear head phones, just not these. I am pretty sure that the people at the customer service line are not gonna help. But I will give it a try anyways, wish me luck. expand » « collapse

Ever wonder why you never see these being used in recording studios? Radio stations? Or why Beats (and Bose) are only sold in department stores and not in high end audio stores?
Are Beats better than the $20 headphone you're used to? Certainly. Are they a good value and the best headphone for the money? Definitely not. If you've never heard a $200 pair of Sennheisers or Sony MDB7506 then you don't know what you're missing.
Quite frankly, why do you see teenagers glowing over these things? Because they've never heard what high end headphones are supposed to so ... und like. Do yourself a favor and test drive some brands and models mentioned in the article above before buying anything. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Solid sound, nice visual package, comfortable fit
Cons: Durability, price
After deciding that I didn't have the coin to drop on the full version of this brand of headphone, I purchased what I assumed would be a quality product. I ended up being disappointed, as I (unfortunately) ended up owning 2 separate pairs of Solos over a period of about 9 months. Both times, the headset broke in the exact same spot along the hinge, on the right side. I wasn't being careless with them at the time, just putting the headset on (in both instances). I also had one pair with a loose left ear-cup, which had to be screwed back on from time to time, which was a minor inconvenience. The good/bad news about all that was: 1) I didn't buy the geek squad protection plan, so I had to use the ori ... ginal warranty (bad news); & 2) i did get the headphones replaced, within a week with no hassle (good news). So, even if you have any problems you should be covered by a pretty decent customer service department, as long as you're still in the warranty period.
It wasn't all bad, as my review would imply. Considering my varied musical tastes, I loved the sound that was produced, even though it could be a bit bass heavy at times (although, that was nothing that a little EQ-tweaking couldn't adjust). Plus, throw in the fact that they looked pretty nice, and were pretty comfortable, I figured it would be worth the price I paid for them.
All that considered, my recommendation is this: If you've got the extra cash to drop on the full set of Beats, I suggest that you purchase those or go with another brand altogether. Otherwise, you run the risk of dealing with a "good" pair of non-durable, expensive headphones you just may end up replacing. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Looking, Great Sounding, Super Comfortable
Cons: Headphones feel frail, but they are well put together.
Having used these headphones for the last few days I can say confidently that they live up to their billing!
You will first be impressed by the look of these headphones as they really are the best looking "On ear" headphones on the market.
Next you will see the "little things" Monster got right with these headphones: A nice case to store them in, a slick microfiber cloth to keep the headphones looking great, the "righ angle" plug for connecting the headphones to your MP3 player, computer, phone or other audio input. Then the "control talk" feature is killer feature, especially for those of you with an Iphone - you can control the volume and answer ... calls without even looking at the phone!
Next up is the actual sound - simply the best I have heard. Comapring these to anything other then premium headphones is a crime. It is clear from the first song I listened to with these that there was something "different" subtle differences with guitars, drums and vocals are easy to pick-out. These headphones do have "noise cancelling" but that is not a strong point - what I mean by this statement is that you really wouldnt wear them exclusively as "noise cancelling headphones" but when music is playing there is no doubt all you hear is the music how the artist meant it to be.
I like how the headphones are put together, the double fold works well with strong hinges. The mix of plastic and medal does give it a fairly odd feeling when an owner is trying to extend the two sides down, they "feel frail" even if that isnt necessarily true. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Decent if you don't mind sound leaking badly.
Item.Review:
Pros: Look great, Very comfortable
Cons: LEAK SOUND, Feel cheaply made, Break easily, Attract fingerprints, Sound good not great
From a Dr. Dre fan who enjoys the music that Dre produces and raps in I can't say that I am a fan of these headphones.
Marketed very well and having a nice design is great, however decent sound quality and sound leakage so bad that even when the volume is turned up a little past half-way everyone in the same room as you can hear the music clear as day isn't so good. Sound quality is good but not much greater than the quality of $39.99 ear buds.
They have a great look but feel cheaply made and easily breakable. Control talk is great, being able to talk and pause songs and increase/decrease volume by simply hitting buttons on the cord is ... cool. These are a very comfortable headphone that really have great cushioning and feel.
I hate to say that the best thing about these headphones is that you can get your money back even after opening them as long as you have your reciept. I believe that the price of these headphones should be no more than $79.99 because the sound isn"t all that superior and they just leak way too much sound, I wore them on a plane ride and I had the volume at 1 click over half-way and was eventually told by the flight attendent to turn down my music, how EMBARASSING!
I don't like to be a hater but the Beats Solo HD by Dr. Dre headphones leak way to much sound and are not that superior sounding either. Don"t get me wrong they sound great especially the bass but they do not sound $160 better than your average ear buds. They are very comfy and look great but feel very cheaply made and the glossy finish attracts many fingerprints.
Bottom line is if you don't mind overpaying for these headphones and you dont mind everyone around you being able to hear every word of your music then these are for you. There is no doubt that you will like the way they feel and look so if you dont mind the sound leakage then these headphones are a decent buy for you. expand » « collapse

I had a VERY bad experience with a pair of Solo/purple beats I purchased for our 15 year old Daughter last June in recognition of a good year in school. They lasted exactly two weeks and then broke in half! If you look at reviews all over he web (Amazon, etc.) this was NOT an isolated event. As other reviewers here have noted, this overpriced "swag" is very poorly made and the warranty/service is a complete farce. I also own many BOSE products and when I had a problem with their Quiet Comfort phones a couple of years ago, I called them and they shipped me a new pair OVERNIGHT, telling me to send the others back when I got the new ones. That is the difference between a quality company and one pretendi ... ng to be. Like $300 sneakers, it's all smoke and mirrors that kids can't see through. But Beats and Monster are assured of eventually losing their market share as their audience grows up and realizes what real quality (like Apple) is all about. BUYERS BEWARE! Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD High Definition On-ear Headphones with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Phones, but You have to be smart!
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound and Warranty
Cons: Not Comfortable, and is Fragile
OKay, so I bought these nearly a year ago, and let me say WOW. These are great headphones, but I'm glad I waited to write a review about them so I could pass on some knowledge to you folks looking to buy them. I really wanted to give these a five but there are a couple of quarks you should know about. Firstly, they are pretty fragile. So make sure you use your case, and make sure you unplug the cord when you store the headphones. and Secondly and most importantly GET THE WARRANTY!. I bought the warranty on a whim and it was the best decision. I got the two year warranty for 20$. My headphones broke(the earpieces get a little wobbly and can pop out). and because I had a warranty they gave me a brand new set. If ... you buy these with a warranty you can potential get a new set of Beats every two years for the rest of your life for about 20$ a pop, because you can get a new warranty on new Headphones. Lastly I just want to say that these are not the most comfortable headphones in the world. If it is in your budget I would recommend getting the bigger kind. But if not these are great and you will love them. So to sum up: Great headphones (amazing sound quality) Get the Warranty so you don't have to worry about them being fragile(which they are). They are pretty comfortable but after a few hours your ears can get a little sore(which can happen with any headphones). expand » « collapse
